result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xymarus T Grant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xymarus T Grant appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Steinle appeared by video for Xymarus T Grant.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Plea hearing proceeded.    

AS TO COUNT 1.  On the motion of the state, and pursuant to plea negotiations, the court ordered count 1  dismissed and read-in for purposes of sentencing.   

AS TO COUNT 2 AND 3.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed. nk
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 060001,
Payable Number: 1016466,
Receipt Number: 22RP026250,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Xymarus T Grant in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties. Court orders defense counsel to file a notice of retainer with the court. Defense counsel agrees and informs court that they have received discovery materials from the State. Further, defense requests a pgp date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-27-2022

Defendant Xymarus T Grant in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle; both appear in person.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court reminded the defendant to continue working with Justice Point. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-06-2022

22RM023562  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/28/2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Xymarus T Grant in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Xymarus T Grant in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Xymarus T Grant appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
